docs.lead_paragraph: Twitter Inc posted the slowest revenue growth since it went public four years ago, sending shares down more than 10 percent on Thursday on fears that rivals Snapchat and Facebook Inc were winning the war for advertising.
docs.snippet: Twitter Inc posted the slowest revenue growth since it went public four years ago, sending shares down more than 10 percent on Thursday on fears that rivals Snapchat and Facebook Inc were winning the war for advertising....

headline.print_headline: Twitter Advertising Revenue Falls, Shares Drop More Than 10 Percent
headline.main: Twitter Advertising Revenue Falls, Shares Drop More Than 10 Percent

docs.lead_paragraph: Numerai makes its investments based on models submitted by data scientists, who are allowed to remain anonymous and who are paid in Bitcoin.
docs.abstract: Numerai, hedge fund powered by ideas from anonymous contributors, will receive $6 million in new investments from group that includes New York-based venture capital firm Union Square Ventures.
docs.snippet: Numerai makes its investments based on models submitted by data scientists, who are allowed to remain anonymous and who are paid in Bitcoin....

headline.print_headline: Hedge Fund Driven by Anonymous Ideas Receives $6 Million in New Investments
headline.main: Hedge Fund Driven by Anonymous Ideas Gets New Investments

docs.lead_paragraph: Apple has ramped up its hiring of artificial intelligence experts, recruiting from PhD programs, posting dozens of job listings and greatly increasing the size of its AI staff, a review of hiring sites suggests and numerous sources confirm.
docs.snippet: Apple has ramped up its hiring of artificial intelligence experts, recruiting from PhD programs, posting dozens of job listings and greatly increasing the size of its AI staff, a review of hiring sites suggests and numerous sources confirm....

headline.print_headline: Exclusive: Apple Ups Hiring, but Faces Obstacles to Making Phones Smarter

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: I agree with some of Richard R. Beeman's criticisms of the U.S. News & World Report college rankings (''Learning Beyond Measure,'' Op-Ed, Sept. 17). But I'd trust those rankings over the word of any college marketing machine any day.
docs.abstract: Letter from Carter Nelsen says he agrees with some of Richard R Beeman's criticisms of US News & World Report college rankings, but he trusts those rankings over word of college marketing machines (Sept 17 Op-Ed)

docs.lead_paragraph: For decades, dominance in the technology industry was based on software or hardware. Now it is increasingly based on who owns the best data.

docs.lead_paragraph: At least 1,200 men in ceremonial attire danced at a mainly Zulu gathering in South Africa on Sunday, wearing a mix of hides of illegally hunted leopards and Chinese-made, spotted capes designed by conservationists to reduce demand for the real thing.

docs.abstract: A so-called computer-vision program was able to outperform humans in identifying handwritten characters. It is a big step in technology that is already finding its way into items ranging from cars to video-game controllers.

headline.main: Daily Report: Machines Outdo Humans in Identifying Characters
